SEARCH
Package executor.service.facade.execution

Class ScenarioWorker

java.lang.Object
executor.service.facade.execution.ScenarioWorker
All Implemented Interfaces:
ExecutionService
@Service public class ScenarioWorker extends Object implements ExecutionService
Service class responsible for executing scenarios in a worker thread. This class implements the ExecutionService interface, defining methods for scenario execution. It utilizes a blocking queue to manage the incoming scenarios and delegates the execution to a ScenarioExecutor.

The ScenarioWorker class encapsulates the following key components: - BlockingQueue<Scenario>: A queue to hold scenarios for processing. - ScenarioExecutor: Responsible for executing scenarios retrieved from the queue. - WebDriverInitializer: Initializes and manages the web driver for scenario execution. - ProxySourcesClient: Client for obtaining proxy sources, if required by scenarios. - ScenarioResultService: Service for managing and persisting scenario execution results.

Instances of this class are typically managed by a Spring container due to the @Service annotation. Ensure that necessary dependencies are injected via constructor injection, providing a cohesive and testable design.

Note: The class assumes a multithreading scenario execution environment, and proper synchronization mechanisms should be considered if shared resources are accessed.

  • Constructor Details

    • ScenarioWorker

      public ScenarioWorker(ScenarioQueueHolder scenarioQueueHolder, ScenarioExecutor scenarioExecutor, WebDriverInitializer webDriverInitializer, ProxySourcesClient proxySourcesClient, ScenarioResultService scenarioResultService)
      Constructor for the ScenarioWorker class, initializing dependencies for scenario execution.

      The constructor takes instances of the following components: - ScenarioQueueHolder: Holds the blocking queue for managing incoming scenarios. - ScenarioExecutor: Responsible for executing scenarios retrieved from the queue. - WebDriverInitializer: Initializes and manages the web driver for scenario execution. - ProxySourcesClient: Client for obtaining proxy sources, if required by scenarios. - ScenarioResultService: Service for managing and persisting scenario execution results.

      This constructor follows the principle of dependency injection via constructor, ensuring that necessary dependencies are provided when creating an instance of the ScenarioWorker class. This approach promotes a modular and testable design.

      Ensure that instances of this class are managed by a Spring container, allowing for automatic dependency injection. Proper configuration of dependencies in the Spring application context is essential for the correct functioning of the ScenarioWorker.

      Parameters:
      scenarioQueueHolder - The ScenarioQueueHolder providing the blocking queue for managing incoming scenarios.
      scenarioExecutor - The ScenarioExecutor responsible for executing scenarios.
      webDriverInitializer - The WebDriverInitializer for initializing and managing the web driver for scenario execution.
      proxySourcesClient - The ProxySourcesClient for obtaining proxy sources, if required by scenarios.
      scenarioResultService - The ScenarioResultService for managing and persisting scenario execution results.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute()
      Executes scenarios in a loop until the current thread is interrupted.

      The method continuously retrieves scenarios from the blocking queue and executes them. It logs the number of scenarios remaining in the queue before processing each scenario.

      The execution loop continues until the thread is interrupted. If an interruption occurs (e.g., due to a shutdown signal), the loop terminates gracefully, allowing for a clean shutdown of the scenario execution.

      Each iteration involves checking the size of the scenario queue, obtaining the next scenario using getScenario(), and executing the scenario if available using execute(Scenario).

      This method is designed to be used in a multi threaded environment, with proper consideration for thread interruption to support clean shutdowns and resource releases.

      Specified by:
      execute in interface ExecutionService
      See Also:
      • getScenario()
      • execute(Scenario)
